messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Disciplining toddlers, was Re: "Expert" Advice (...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/7/01 8:33:01 AM Pacific Daylight Time, diamondair@email.msn.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/7/01 8:33:01 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
diamondair@... writes:

<< So at this point it becomes a matter of opinion and
of where each person draws their line, but I don't think it's possible to
argue that there aren't lines to be drawn at all. It is possible to
understand that some folks feel that a small amount of violence is not
harmful to their kids. It is also possible to understand that others feel
quite strongly that any amount of violence is too much for any child.
>>

Robin, I love this post! You have expressed so many things that I'm
trying to say. It is not intolerance to have strong convictions about
something being good or wrong and I think most people have these convictions
in some form.

Lucy
